archimate:ArchimateDiagramModel.documentation:
HIS (Hospital Information System)
Purpose: Central backbone for all administrative and non-clinical operations across the hospital.
Core Modules & Functions:
• Patient Administration: Admissions, discharges, transfers (ADT) workflow; bed management; wait-list tracking • Billing & Revenue Cycle: Insurance eligibility checks, charge capture, claims submission, payment posting, reporting • Scheduling: Resource (rooms, equipment, staff) and appointment booking; operating room block scheduling • Order Management: Non-clinical orders (e.g., dietary, housekeeping, transport requests) • Reporting & Analytics: Operational dashboards (throughput, occupancy, financial KPIs)
Architecture & Integration:
• Often built on a service-oriented architecture (SOA) that exposes patient master index (PMI) and scheduling services for downstream systems • Integrates with EHR/LIS/PACS via HL7 or FHIR interfaces for order reconciliation and patient demographics • May include its own document-management or link to third-party ECM (Enterprise Content Management)
Example Software Highlights:
• Cerner Millennium: Real-time bed visibility, dynamic chargemaster management, revenue integrity tools • Epic Hyperspace: Unified ADT and billing workflows, embedded staff scheduling, built-in analytics via Cogito
